issue.title: Fix #649: fixed hashCode impl regression

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.body:
This PR addresses GitHub issue: #649 .

Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

* hashCode implementation for SimpleLiteral and AbstractBindingSet re-fixed (see SES-2188)
* added unit tests to avoid future regression

issue.title: SimpleLiteral hashCode should ignore case for language tags

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.title: Revert change to Literal hashCode implementation

milestone.description: Issue to be fixed in 2.1.3 patch release

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.body:
In #649 we included a literal's language tag and datatype in generation of the hashcode.

However, there are several problems with this:

1. It breaks the RDF4J API specification: it is expicitly documented on the `Literal` interface that the hashcode is calculated using the literal's label only. 
2. It introduces an unnecessary performance penalty which may impact performance of `Statement` collections (any `Set` or `List` as well as `Model`), as well as the `MemoryStore`.
3. The current implementation breaks the Java hashcode contract because it generates different hashcodes for two Literals which are considered equal (that is, with uppercase or lowercase language tags). See issue #665 for extended discussion.

To fix, we will revert the changes to the hashcode implementation, and go back to a label-only implemention. This will resolve all three above problems at once.

issue.title: Improve Literal.hashCode() contract

labels.name: üì∂ enhancement
labels.description: issue is a new feature or improvement

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.body:
The current contract for `Literal/.hashCode()` is based only on `getLabel()` value.

>  @return a hash code for this literal computed as {@link #getLabel()}{@code .hashCode()}

While not incorrect, the requirement could be improved upon by including also the `.getLanguage()/.getDatatype()` values already considered in `.equals()`, as

> @return a hash code for this literal computed as {@link java.util.Objects#hash(Object...)}({@link #getLabel()}, {@link #getLanguage()}, {@link #getDatatype()})


Concrete implementations currently overriding these methods must be aligned as per #2564.
